member.name: M:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CBase.IsLTMIMSpecOn

summary.para: Check following spec. code:
NC Spec Code 2 [3,6] TMIM for P300S or newer controls
NC Spec Code 2 [27,2] LTIM for P300L or newer controls

member.returns: A System.Boolean value. It returns false if the Spec Code is off. Otherwise, it returns TRUE.

remarks.para: All tool-related functions designed specifically for P300S or newer controls cannot be supported and it is automatically in TL mode when IsLTMIMSpecOn function returns FALSE.
All tool-related functions designed specifically for P300L or newer controls cannot be supported when IsLTMIMSpecOn function returns FALSE.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Register a tool at the specified pot number with other tool attributes.
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
Private Sub RegisterTool() Dim objcatc As CATC2 Dim intPotNo, intGroupNo, intSerialNo, intEdges, intToolAngle As Integer Dim enTurret as TurretEnum Dim enToolKind As ToolIDSettingToolKindEnum Dim enToolSize As ToolIDSettingToolSizeEnum Dim enReturnMagazine As ReturnMagazineEnum Try objcatc = New CATC2() objcatc.RegisterToolPot(intPotNo, intGroupNo, intSerialNo, enToolKind, intEdges, enToolSize, intToolAngle, enReturnMagazine, enTurret) Catch ae As ApplicationException Throw Catch ex As Exception Throw End Try End Sub
Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Group number to be registered for the tool Serial number to be registered for the tool Number of edges for multi-point tool kind Tool Kind for the registered tool Tool Size for the registered tool
Tool angle for multi-point tool kind
Valid angle for 12 edges tool: 0/30/60/90/120/150/180/210/240/270/300/330
Valid angle for other multi-edge tool: 0/45/90/135/180/225/270/315
Turret number for the registered tool
Magazine to be returned Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
Note 1:
When a large, super-large, right-large or left-large diameter tool is returned from the turret to the magazine, the tool is always returned to the pot where it was stored previously. The pot where any of a super-large, an R-large and an L-large diameter tool is stored is recognized as the pot for which the tool to be returned is determined (the pot is called a “reserved pot”) when a tool is removed from such a pot. Tools other than the previously stored tool are not returned to the pot recognized as the reserved pot. The reserved pot is displayed with a R letter.
Note 2:
1) The tool cannot be registered due to a duplicate tool number if a tool with the same group number and the same serial number exists in another pot.
2) The tool ID data can be deleted by changing both the group and serial numbers to 0.
3) If the tool has been registered, the data in the tool setting window cannot be directly edited. Delete the data once and create again.
4) The “RETURN MAGAZINE” setting is only effective for models with multiple magazines or subsidiary magazine. Otherwise, the data is not displayed or set up.
5) The TIPS (CHIP) and TIP (CHIP) ANGLE settings are only effective when a ML tool (a multiple edge tool) is selected as tool kind. Otherwise, the data will not be displayed or set up. Do not specify the same tip angle for multiple tips of a multiple edge tool. Specifying duplicated angles results in an error.
6) ML tool (multiple edge tool) cannot be selected as tool kind for the B-turret. Selecting it results in an error. The RETURN MAGAZINE data will not be displayed or set up for the B-turret.
7) Selecting a size other than normal diameter with the adjacent pots occupied leads to an error. Extra-big diameter tool: The preceding or following pots shall be empty. Right big diameter tool: The preceding pot shall be empty. Left big diameter tool: The following pot shall be empty. SL tool: The preceding and following pots shall not be occupied by a dummy tool or a big diameter tool.
ATC TOOL INFORMATION
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets user alarm given user alarm sub system
Alarm Message displayed on NC-HMI will have the following format:
FOR ALARM D: 4127 ALARM-D THINC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
FOR ALARM C: 3127 ALARM-C THINC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
FOR ALARM B: 2127 ALARM-B THINC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
This example shows how to call the SetUserAlarm method.
Dim objCMDMachine As New CMachine Dim enAlarm As UserAlarmEnum Dim strAlarmMessage As String = "USER ALARM" Dim enValue As UserAlarmSubSystemEnum = UserAlarmSubSystemEnum.All objCMDMachine.SetUserAlarm(enAlarm, strAlarmMessage, enUserAlarmSubSystem)
alarm level to be set alarm message to be set for this alarm level. String length must be equal to or less than 15 characters. User Alarm Sub System to be applied. Value of parameter comes from Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.UserAlarmSubSystemEnum. Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
********************* This function cannot be supported in OSP-P100 II machines. ************************
********************* This function requires license feature Okuma.Lathe.UserAlarm if applicable. ************************
[Lhuynh] 10/01/2012 Created

member.name: M:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.SelectMainProgram(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load the specified part program file into NC. Optionally, it can also load sub routines based on sub program file name, system subtitute program file name, or a particular program name.
member.example:
This example shows how to call SelectMainProgram method to load part program named A.MIN in \MD1\Part2 folder.
Dim strMainProgramFileName As String = "A.MIN" Dim strSubProgramFileName As String = "" Dim strSystemSubstituteProgramFileName As String = "" Dim strProgramName As String = "" Dim strSubFolder As String = "\Part2\" Dim objCMDProgram As CProgram = New CProgram() if strSubFolder.Trim.Length = 0 then objCMDProgram.SelectMainProgram(strMainProgramFileName, strSubProgramFileName, strSystemSubtituteProgramFileName, strProgramName) else objCMDProgram.SelectMainProgram(strSubFolder + strMainProgramFileName, strSubFolder + strSubProgramFileName, strSubFolder + strSystemSubtituteProgramFileName, strProgramName) End If
member.param: Main program file name to be loaded into NC
Sub program file name to be used for the main program if available
System Subtitute Programe file name (SSB) to be used for the main program if available
Program Name. It can be specified to load a particular program name inside program file name. Program name must be start with capital O plus 4 characters for program name such as O1234.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.remarks: All program files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system or in sub folder relatively to the MD1 folder.

member.name: M:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.SequenceRestart(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Perform the sequence restart at the specified sequence number when execution of a program has been interrupted during an automatic operation by tool breakage, entangled chips, or some other causes. The program is restarted from the block immediately before the one where the operation was interrupted.
For more information, please refer to Lathe Operation Manual - Section 5 Automatic Operation - Sequence Restart
member.example:
This example shows how to call SequenceRestart method.
Dim strSequence As String Dim intOrderNumber As Integer objCMDProgram.SequenceRestart(strSequence,intOrderNumber )
member.param: Sequence number or block counter. Sequence restart starts with N + 4 sequence numbers. For example, N1234 is a sequence name.

The “order” when designating a sequence name is a value that specifies, in cases where the same sequence number occurs a number of times in the same part program, the position of the sequence number from which the sequence is to be restarted. It indicates which occurrence of the sequence number - starting from the first block of the part program - is the relevant one.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: AUTO OPERATION - RESTART SEQUENCE
member.history: [Lhuynh] 10/22/2007 Created Support in LCMDAPI.exe version 1.0.2.1, Lathe.dll 2.0.2.7

member.name: M:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.LoadATDFile(System.String)
member.summary:
Load the specified ATD (Attached Tool Data) file into NC.
Note: No operation mode can be changed during this operation.
Note: This function will perform an operation as one would perform the TOOLLISTLOAD on NC-HMI by selecting an ATD file to load into NC.
member.example:
This example shows how to call LoadATDFile method.
Dim objCMDProgram As New CProgram Dim strATDFileName As String = "TEST.ATD" objCMDProgram.LoadATDFile(strATDFileName)
member.param: Load ATD file name located in MD1 folder
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.Figure: TOOL DATA - TURRET INFO - TOOL LIST LOAD

remarks.para: All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.
The folllowing NC spec codes must be active on target machines:
BASE OP. SCREEN NC2 [3,5] BOPS
L TOOL MAC INFORM NC2 [27,2] LTIM
The folllowing NC Optional parameter must be active on target machines:
ATD File reading function - Optional Parameter bit: [54,5]

Compatible Chart of this function for different OSP controls:
OSP Control Compatible
P300L and newer controls Yes
For OSP-P300 control, this function is required to operate in an exclusive mode.
NC must be not running
Tool is not in Edit mode and entering editing mode during the entire operation by any application including NC-HMI

member.name: M:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.LoadPETFile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Load the specified PET file
For P300L: NC will also load DDT and ATD files if applicable. It will then make and transfer model data of Easy modeling.
Note: No operation mode can be changed during this operation.
Note: This function will perform an operation as one would perform the program select of PET file on IGF-DAT SEL screen as shown below.

member.example:
This example shows how to call LoadPETFile method.
Dim objCMDProgram As New CProgram Dim strPETFileName As String = "TEST.PET" Dim blnLoadDDTFile As Boolean = False Dim blnLoadDDTFile As Boolean = False objCMDProgram.LoadPETFile(strPETFileName, blnLoadDDTFile, blnLoadDDTFile)
member.param: Load PET file name
Optional: Load DDT file name if specified
Optional: Load ATD file name if specified for P300L or newer only. System will ignore if specified on P300S or newer control
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.

Register a tool at the specified pot number with other tool attributes.
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
Dim objCATC As CATC = New CATC Dim intPotNo As Integer Dim intToolNo As Integer Dim enSettingToolKind As Integer Dim enSettingToolKind As SettingToolKindEnum Dim enReturnMagazine As ReturnMagazineEnum objCATC.RegisterTool(intPotNo, intToolNo, enSettingToolKind, enSettingToolSize, enReturnMagazine)
testing Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Tool number to be registered Tool Kind for the registered tool Tool Size for the registered tool Return magazine number for the registered tool and applicable for ATC having sub magazine only Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
When a large, super-large, right-large or left-large diameter tool is returned from the turret to the magazine, the tool is always returned to the pot where it was stored previously. The pot where any of a super-large, an R-large and an L-large diameter tool is stored is recognized as the pot for which the tool to be returned is determined (the pot is called a “reserved pot”) when a tool is removed from such a pot. Tools other than the previously stored tool are not returned to the pot recognized as the reserved pot. The reserved pot is displayed with a R letter.

Register a new tool into the system when target number is zero.
Register a new tool into the system and attach the tool into the specified target number if provided when NC is not running.
This example shows how to call the RegisterTool method.
Tool number
Target number: Magazine pot/Turret station.
If target number is 0, tool will be registered into the system only without attaching to a tool location
Spefiy target number = 1 for attaching tool to H1 Turret location
For OSP-P300S: Edge number. Specifying 0 for registering standard tool (non-multi edges tool). Otherwise it is from 1 to 12 if applicable.
Multi-Edges Tool specification is NC spec code [5,3] ON
12 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 0] ON
8 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 1] ON
4 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 4] ON
Tool kind. Dummy Tool cannot be set for Multi-Edge tool.
For OSP-P300S: Tool size
Spindle axis. Specifying NONE in case of sub spindle NC spec [4,1] is OFF
For OSP-P300S: Cutting position. Specifying None for B Turret location
For OSP-P300S: BA angle depends on machine specification if supported. Not applicable for B Turret locations
Location of tool to be registered with.
If Location is Magazine and Target number is greater than zero then tool is registered with the system and attached to target location on ATC magazine.
If Location is H1 Turret then tool is automatically registered with the system and attached to H1 turret when target number is 1.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logException
member.summary: Level 1 – All exceptions will be logged by the system. (not settable). It is highly not recommended to have polling routines that produce exceptions for any purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logSet
member.summary: Level 2 – Level 1 + all write functions to the API (default value for all class instances)

member.name: F:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logGet
member.summary: Level 3 – Level 2 + all read functions. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logAll
member.summary: Level 4 – all logging events regardless of level. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: T:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- A Turret of first machine/R side of 2 sides machine
- Main spindle of first machine/R side of 2 sides machine

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- A Turret of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Sub/second spindle of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Required Sub spindle specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- B Turret of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Main spindle of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Required 4-axis and 2 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- B Turret of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Sub/second spindle of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Required Sub spindle and 4-axis and 2 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- A Turret of second machine/L side of 2 sides machine
- Main spindle of second machine/L side of 2 sides machine
- Required parallel 2 spindles specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- C Turret of first machine
- Main spindle of first machine
- Required 3 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- C Turret of first machine
- Sub/second spindle of first machine
- Required Sub spindle and 3 Turrets specification

member.name: T:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolEdgeEnum
member.summary:
Represent the edge number for Multi-Edges Tool specification
OSP-P300S:
Multi-Edges Tool specification is NC spec code [5,3] ON
12 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 0] ON
8 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 1] ON
4 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 4] ON
ENo
OSP-P300L:
Machines with Multi-Tool spec (NC Spec Code 2 [24, 7] MLTL = ON): It can only support up to 8 edges per tool.
TOOL DATA - TOOL LIFE MANAGEMENT
ENO.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.SettingToolSizeEnum.ME_Tool
member.summary: ME Super-Large Diameter tool. It is applicable when Extended Magazine Tool Data PLC3 spec code [72,7] is ON Note: Physical pots on magazine must be designated for large tool in order to be valid and can be varied per machine spec. All tools having either one of these attributes ME, MR, or ML can share its dummy pots with each other. For example: Tool 309, 311, and 313 with ML, ME, and MR attribute, respectively can be inserted into magazine pot 309, 311, 313, respectively

Mode at which NC is under either Auto/MDI/Manual mode.
Auto/MDI/Manual mode cannot be changed by this panel mode, but the screen can be changed while NC in one of these modes.
For example, screen can be changed from ACTUAL POSITION to MAIN PROGRAM.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode program and data files can be edited, input/output, displayed, and deleted

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode the parameter data necessary for numerical control can be set, changed, an displayed.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode the zero offset data and zero offset shift data which define a program coordinate system can be set, changed, or checked.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In this mode the tool offset data, nose radius compensation data, tool shape data, and load monitor data can be set, changed, or displayed

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.SubSystemEnum

summary.para: List of available sub systems to functions, if applicable.
By default, the sub system is NC-AL for every instance of classes in the Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI namespace if applicable.

member.remarks:
For Lathe/Multus/Macturn, the machine data area is logically divided into 4 main logical data areas as shown in the figure below.
The following four coordinate systems are available by the combination of 2 turrets and 2 spindles
The following multi-coordinate systems are available by the combination of 3 turrets and 2 spindles
The chart below shows the validity of each sub system based on machine specification if applicable.
*****************************************************
Application Notes 1: The following subsystem should be never used for getting/setting distinctive logical data. It can be used for displaying purpose since these subsystems will return values based on current Panel selection or Program Command Selection on NC.
NC-RUN,NC-RUN-1/2/3, NC-PANEL, NC-PANEL-1/2/3
*****************************************************
Application Notes 2: To assure that you are always get/set the same logical data areas mentioned above you can always set the subsystem accordingly.
For example:
1/ Machine equipped with main spindle and single turret:
NC-AL => Data area in the upper left corner as shown in figure
2/ Machine equipped with multiple spindles and turrets:
NC-AL => Data area in the upper left corner as shown in figure
NC-AR => Data area in the upper right corner as shown in figure
NC-BL => Data area in the lower left corner as shown in figure
NC-BR => Data area in the lower right corner as shown in figure
NC-CL => Data area in the upper left corner as shown in figure
NC-CR => Data area in the upper right corner as shown in figure
3/ Machine equipped with main spindle, sub spindle, and single turret
NC-AL => Data area in the upper left corner as shown in figure
NC-AR => Data area in the upper right corner as shown in figure
4/ NC-RUN-1/2/3 should not be used on certain machine data in this machine configuration since it depends on Program Command G140 or G141 (spindle selection) which gets/sets data differently.
5/ For machine that has left and right side or parallel 2 spindles specification, the sub system NC-2-AL is used to designate the upper left data area on second side of machine which is the L side. The R side machine can be addressed by other subsystem as normal single side machine.
*****************************************************
Application Notes 3:
Not all machines support all subsystems.
It is necessary to specify the sub system to obtain different machine data if applicable.
For example:
In order to get tool offset values for machine that has 3 turrets - A, B, and C turret, the sub system must be set for A, B, and C turret as shown below:
objToolsAL.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_AL) 'set current subsystem to A Turret
objToolsAL.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in A turret for the specified offset index and axis index
objToolsBL.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_BL) 'set current subsystem to B Turret
objToolsBL.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in B turret for the specified offset index and axis index
objToolsCL.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_CL) 'set current subsystem to C Turret
objToolsCL.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in C turret for the specified offset index and axis index
objToolsAR.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_AR) 'set current subsystem to A Turret for right spindle
objToolsAR.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in A turret for the specified offset index and axis index
objToolsBR.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_BR) 'set current subsystem to B Turret for right spindle
objToolsBR.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in B turret for the specified offset index and axis index
objToolsCR.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_CR) 'set current subsystem to C Turret for right spindle
objToolsCR.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in C turret for the specified offset index and axis index
For machine that has only A turret, tool offset value can be obtained by setting sub system to NC-AL.
A NotSupportedException will be thrown if trying to access tool offset values in B Turret
By default, the sub system is NC_AL. The data will be the upper left data area of the machine.
For 2 sides machines, Left and Right side, the data on second machine or L side of machine can be obtained by specifying NC_2AL.
The data on first machine or R side of machine can be obtained by specifying other sub systems.
For example:
objTools1.SetSubSystem(SubSystemEnum.NC_2AL) 'set current subsystem to A turret on second machine (second machine or L side of 2 sides machine)
objTools1.GetToolOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex) 'obtain tool offset value in A turret for the specified offset index and axis index on second machine (L side of 2 sides machine)
*****************************************************
Application Notes 4:
All exceptions generated by API and all set/add/cal functions will be logged. Therefore, the application must be designed to minimize
unnecessary log by utilizing Object-Oriented Programming practices or preventing perform set/add/cal functions in a loop.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Create an instance of this class. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.
[Lhuynh] 12/4/2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

members.member:
Determines the offset value based on the input value and actual position.
Data unit is current setting of NC Data Unit.
This example shows how to call the CalculateToolOffset method.
Dim objTools As New CTools Dim intOffsetNo As Integer Dim enAxisIndex As OffsetAxisIndexEnum Dim enSubSystem As SubSystemEnum Dim dblValue As Double objTools.CalculateToolOffset(intOffsetNo, enAxisIndex, enSubSystem, dblValue)
Offset number. Axis Index. Value of parameter comes from Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.OffsetAxisIndexEnum. Sub System. Value of parameter comes from Okuma.CLCMDAPI.Enumerations.SubSystemEnum. Input value to be calculated from Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system. TOOL OFFSET/NOSE R COMPENSATION - CAL FOR INDEX 1, X AXIS, A Turret
********************* This function cannot be supported in OSP-P100 II machines. ************************
The internal calculation in the NC is as follows:
Tool offset value = Calculated value (actual tool position relative to machine zero) - Zero offset value - Input value (value measured with a micrometer)
Compatible Chart of this function for different OSP controls:
OSP Control Compatible
P100II No
P200 Yes
P300L and newer controls Yes
P300S/TD Mode and newer controls Yes IF NC Spec Code 2 [3,6] TMIM = OFF
P300S/TL Mode and newer controls Yes
[Lhuynh] 10/22/2007 Created [Lhuynh] 3/25/2008 add control-type check routine
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Okuma.CLCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CSimulation.SelectGraphLineAnimate

Dim curSpecEnum As OptionSpecEnum Try Me.specSaddleSpec.Text = objSpec.Get2SaddleSpec specInterfaceVersion.Text = objCMDSpec.GetInterfaceVersion() Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CSpec", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CSpec", ex.Message) End Try
member.returns: A System.String value that represents the version of this library. Version format: Major.Minor.Build.Revision
